Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: McCarthy, D., J. Ge, J. Hinz, R. Finn, and R. de Jong, R. PISCES: A Wide-Field, 1-2.5 um Camera for Large-Aperture Telescopes. PASP, 115, 353-361, doi:10.1086/319328, 2001.

Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== PISCES is a wide-field (1024x1024 Rockwell HAWAII array) near-IR camera designed to be used at the Kitt Peak 90-in, Mt. Bigelow 61-in, and MMT 6.5-m. The camera has a circular 8.5 arcmin diameter field of view and a pixel scale of 0.5'/pix on the two smaller telescopes. It has a 3.1 arcmin field of view and pixel scale of 0.18'/pix at the MMT. The camera has a warm CaF2 dewar window and five BaF2 and fused silica lenses at cryogenic temperatures. It also has a pupil viewing mode. The dewar was made by Infrared Labs, Inc. Fiber optics connect a PC to the array electronics.
A full description of the PISCES instrument can be found in:
McCarthy, D., J. Ge, J. Hinz, R. Finn, & R. de Jong, R. 2001, PISCES: A Wide-Field, 1a2.5 um Camera for Large-Aperture Telescopes. PASP, 115, 353.
